xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: XSLT Module

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: xsl:current
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: xsl:current() as item()

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: The function, used within an XPath expression, returns the item that was the context item at the point where the expression was invoked from the XSLT stylesheet.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: xsl:document
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: xsl:document($ as node()*) as node()*

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: The function allows access to XML documents identified by a URI.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: xsl:document
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: xsl:document($ as node()*, $ as node()) as node()*

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: The function allows access to XML documents identified by a URI.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: xsl:format-date
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: xsl:format-date($date as xs:date?, $picture as xs:string, $language as xs:string?, $calendar as xs:string?, $country as xs:string?) as xs:string?

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: The functions formats a date as a string using the picture string.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: xsl:format-date
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: xsl:format-date($date as xs:date?, $picture as xs:string) as xs:string?

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: The functions formats a date as a string using the picture string.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: xsl:format-dateTime
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: xsl:format-dateTime($date-TIME as xs:dateTime?, $picture as xs:string, $language as xs:string?, $calendar as xs:string?, $country as xs:string?) as xs:string?

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: The functions formats a dateTime as a string using the picture string.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: xsl:format-dateTime
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: xsl:format-dateTime($date-TIME as xs:dateTime?, $picture as xs:string) as xs:string?

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: The functions formats a dateTime as a string using the picture string.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: xsl:format-number
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: xsl:format-number($number as numeric?, $format as xs:string) as xs:string

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: The format-number function converts its first argument to a string using the format pattern string specified by the second argument and the decimal-format named by the third argument, or the default decimal-format, if there is no third argument. The format pattern string is in the syntax specified by the JDK 1.1 DecimalFormat class. The format pattern string is in a localized notation: the decimal-format determines what characters have a special meaning in the pattern (with the exception of the quote character, which is not localized). The format pattern must not contain the currency sign (#x00A4); support for this feature was added after the initial release of JDK 1.1. The decimal-format name must be a QName, which is expanded as described in [2.4 Qualified Names]. It is an error if the stylesheet does not contain a declaration of the decimal-format with the specified expanded-name.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $format The format pattern string. Please see the JavaDoc for java.text.DecimalFormat to get the specifics of this format string.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: xsl:format-number
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: xsl:format-number($number as numeric?, $format as xs:string, $decimalformat as xs:string) as xs:string

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: The format-number function converts its first argument to a string using the format pattern string specified by the second argument and the decimal-format named by the third argument, or the default decimal-format, if there is no third argument. The format pattern string is in the syntax specified by the JDK 1.1 DecimalFormat class. The format pattern string is in a localized notation: the decimal-format determines what characters have a special meaning in the pattern (with the exception of the quote character, which is not localized). The format pattern must not contain the currency sign (#x00A4); support for this feature was added after the initial release of JDK 1.1. The decimal-format name must be a QName, which is expanded as described in [2.4 Qualified Names]. It is an error if the stylesheet does not contain a declaration of the decimal-format with the specified expanded-name. NOTE: The decimalformat parameter is currently not implemented and is ignored.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $format The format pattern string. Please see the JavaDoc for java.text.DecimalFormat to get the specifics of this format string.

$decimalformat The decimal-format name must be a QName, which is expanded as described in [2.4 Qualified Names]. It is an error if the stylesheet does not contain a declaration of the decimal-format with the specified expanded-name.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: xsl:format-time
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: xsl:format-time($time as xs:time?, $picture as xs:string, $language as xs:string?, $calendar as xs:string?, $country as xs:string?) as xs:string?

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: The functions formats a time as a string using the picture string.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: xsl:format-time
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: xsl:format-time($time as xs:time?, $picture as xs:string) as xs:string?

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: The functions formats a time as a string using the picture string.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: xsl:generate-id
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: xsl:generate-id() as item()

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: The function returns a string that uniquely identifies a given node.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: xsl:key
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: xsl:key($ as xs:string, $ as xs:anyAtomicType*) as node()*

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: The function does for keys what the id FO function does for IDs

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: xsl:key
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: xsl:key($ as xs:string, $ as xs:anyAtomicType*, $ as node()) as node()?

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: The function does for keys what the id FO function does for IDs

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: xsl:system-property
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: xsl:system-property($ as xs:string) as xs:string

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: The function returns a string representing the value of the system property identified by the name.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: xsl:unparsed-entity-public-id
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: xsl:unparsed-entity-public-id($ as xs:string) as xs:string

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: The function returns the public identifier of the unparsed entity whose name is given by the value of the $entity-name argument, in the document containing the context node.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: xsl:unparsed-entity-uri
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: xsl:unparsed-entity-uri($ as xs:string) as xs:anyURI

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: The function returns the URI of the unparsed entity whose name is given by the value of the $entity-name argument, in the document containing the context node.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: xsl:unparsed-text-available
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: xsl:unparsed-text-available($ as xs:string?) as xs:boolean

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: The function determines whether a call on the unparsed-text function with identical arguments would return a string.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: xsl:unparsed-text-available
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: xsl:unparsed-text-available($ as xs:string?, $ as xs:string?) as xs:boolean

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: The function determines whether a call on the unparsed-text function with identical arguments would return a string.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: xsl:unparsed-text
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: xsl:unparsed-text($ as xs:string?) as xs:string?

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: The function reads an external resource (for example, a file) and returns its contents as a string.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: xsl:unparsed-text
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: xsl:unparsed-text($ as xs:string?, $ as xs:string) as xs:string?

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: The function reads an external resource (for example, a file) and returns its contents as a string.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: xsl:generate-id
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: xsl:generate-id() as item()

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: The function returns a string that uniquely identifies a given node.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: xsl:generate-id
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: xsl:generate-id($ as node()?) as item()

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: The function returns a string that uniquely identifies a given node.
